channel.title: Peter's stats stuff
channel.description: I write about applications of data and analytical techniques like statistical modelling and simulation to real-world situations. I show how to access and use data, and provide examples of analytical products and the code that produced them.

item.title: Books I like
item.description: My ten recommended books for applied statistics and data science. Then 13 more!

item.title: Cross-validation of topic modelling
item.description: Cross-validation of the "perplexity" from a topic model, to help determine a good number of topics.

item.title: Sparse matrices, k-means clustering, topic modelling with posts on the 2004 US Presidential election
item.description: I explore different sparse matrix formats in R and moving data from R to H2O. Along the way I use k-means clustering and topic modelling to explore textual data from the Daily Kos blog on the 2004 US Presidential election.

item.title: Extracting data on shadow economy from PDF tables
item.description: The shadow economy as a percentage of GDP in wealthier countries is in decline; and had a spike in 2009 with the economic crisis. More research is needed to adequately understand it. Along the way I experiment with extracting data frames from PDF tables; and show it's always worthwhile looking at the same data in different ways, which can be as simple as freeing up the vertical axes of graphics.

item.title: forecastHybrid 0.3.0 on CRAN
item.description: forecastHybrid 0.3.0 for ensemble time series forecasting is now on CRAN. Two new features are prediction intervals for the nnetar (neural network) component of the combination; and theta method models.

item.title: Air quality in Indian cities
item.description: Air pollution in Indian cities is unambiguously seasonal, and also might have a Diwali impact.

item.title: Extrapolation is tough for trees!
item.description: Tree-based predictive analytics methods like random forests and extreme gradient boosting may perform poorly with data that is out of the range of the original training data.

item.title: Why time series forecasts prediction intervals aren't as good as we'd hope
item.description: A quick demonstration of the impact of inevitably random estimates of the parameters and meta-parameters in ARIMA time series modelling

item.title: Error, trend, seasonality - ets and its forecast model friends
item.description: I check out exponential smoothing state space models for univariate time series as a general family of forecasting models, and in particular the `ets`, `stlm` and `thetaf` functions from Hyndman's forecast R package. For monthly and quarterly seasonal data, `thetaf` seems to be slightly outperformed by its more flexible and general cousins.

item.title: Declining sea ice in the Arctic
item.description: Adding a (small amount of) polish to a well known chart of seasonal Arctic sea declining over the years.
